comments:
Using attachment 60820, if I use the Axis2 runtime preference to set the Axis2 runtime location, then exit Eclipse and go into the same workspace again, the Axis2 runtime location is lost.  Here's what's in the console:

If I use the Axis2 runtime preference to load the Axis2 runtime again, then the scenario would completes fine.

Created an attachment (id=60915)
fix for the bug 

patch version of the fix 
tested on windows/linux

I tried the fix and it still did not work in Windows.  I did some debugging and found that instead of returning "D:\axis2-1.1.1\", properties.getProperty(Axis2CoreUIMessages.PROPERTY_KEY_PATH) returns "D:\axis2-1.1.1\" causing:

java.io.FileNotFoundException: D:axis2-1.1.1\dist\axis2.war (The system cannot find the path specified.)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:135)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:95)
	at org.apache.axis2.facet.utils.Axis2RuntimeUtils.copyAxis2War(Axis2RuntimeUtils.java:79)
	at org.apache.axis2.facet.commands.Axis2WebservicesServerCommand.exexuteOverrride(Axis2WebservicesServerCommand.java:50)

(In reply to comment #2)
As I mentioned in the mail. Yesterday i attach the both patches to 177410 & 177406 Out of it the 177410 have being failed during the attaching process.
The patch attach to the 177410 needed to this. 
Please test with the 177410 also applied together with the patch. 

I have tested this it is working for me

Thanks 

Sandakith
